title: 2011(No. 23 of 2011)) of the Private Security Services Act 2004 (No. 12 of
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Private Security (Security Guard
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Private Security (Security Guard 

Temporary Licence) Regulations 2022.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited private security (security guard temporary licence) regulation 2022

title: 2011(No. 23 of 2011)) of the Private Security Services Act 2004 (No. 12 of
heading: 2. These Regulations come into operation on the 1st day of November
text_raw: 2. These Regulations come into operation on the 1st day of November

title: 2011(No. 23 of 2011)) of the Private Security Services Act 2004 (No. 12 of
2011(No. 23 of 2011)) of the Private Security Services Act 2004 (No. 12 of
heading: In these Regulations –
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations – 

“Act” means the Private Security Services Act 2004 as amended by the Civil 
Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2011 and the Private Security Services 
(Amendment) Act 2021; 

“licence” means a licence issued under Section 27A of the Act; 

“security guard temporary licence” means a person who for remuneration as a 
security guard, guards or patrols or provides any other protective services in 
relation to any premises or any other place where a public or private event or 
function is taking place or about to take place and includes a person who for 
those purposes controls, supervises, regulates, restricts or directs 
the 
movements of persons, whether in vehicles or otherwise;
text_norm: 3 regulation - act mean private security service act 2004 amended civil law (miscellaneous provisions) act 2011 private security service (amendment) act 2021 licence mean licence issued section 27a act security guard temporary licence mean person remuneration security guard guard patrol provides protective service relation premise place public private event function taking place take place includes person purpose control supervises regulates restricts directs movement person whether vehicle otherwise

title: 2011(No. 23 of 2011)) of the Private Security Services Act 2004 (No. 12 of
heading: 4. An applicant shall pay a fee of €30 in respect of each licence issued.
text_raw: 4. An applicant shall pay a fee of €30 in respect of each licence issued.
text_norm: 4 applicant shall pay fee eur30 respect licence issued

title: 2011(No. 23 of 2011)) of the Private Security Services Act 2004 (No. 12 of
heading: 5. PSA Training Requirements for Temporary Licences (PSA 49:2020) is
text_raw:
5. PSA Training Requirements for Temporary Licences (PSA 49:2020) is 

prescribed as the training to be completed by an applicant for a licence. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 18th November, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The Minister for Justice consents to the making of the foregoing Regulations. 

[573] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

25 October, 2022. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice. 

GIVEN under the seal of the Private Security Authority, 

28 October, 2022. 

RICHARD O’FARRELL 
 Chairperson 

PAUL SCALLAN 
 Chief Executive
